text:
Has anyone added auth to their CMS app and/or HubSpot serverless functions?

Would love to be able to know which user is currently calling my serverless function using some JWT or something, having the client pass their email address is not secure of course.

Great that <#C011F74BKQW|serverless-functions> can <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/platform/serverless-functions#authenticate-calls|call HubSpot API and supports secrets>.
But if this endpoint has no auth then anyone could call that function from the internet and potentially scrape and/or mutate data.
Using <https://github.HubSpot.com/cms-react/reference/data-fetching.html|GraphQL to fetch most data server side>, so that's presumably secure. But if you want a client to be able to interact and mutate data then you need something like a serverless function, but you want it to be secure behind auth.
